  "Initiated By" : "TEXAS",
  "Allegations" : "WHILE REGISTERED WITH SGC, RESPONDENT REPRESENTED TO CO-WORKERS, SGC CLIENTS, SGC PROSPECTIVE CLIENTS, AND SGC FINANCIAL ADVISORS THAT HE WAS A CHARTERED FINANCIAL ANALYST (CFA).  RESPONDENT WAS NOT, AND HAS NEVER BEEN, A CFA CHARTERHOLDER.  HOWEVER, RESPONDENT USED THE CFA DESIGNATION ON THOUSANDS OF E-MAILS AND ON HIS BUSINESS CARDS.  RESPONDENT ALSO FABRICATED AN E-MAIL TO SGC TO CREATE THE IMPRESSION THAT THE CFA INSTITUTE HAD SENT THE MESSAGE TO CONGRATULATE RESPONDENT ON PASSING THE LEVEL III CFA EXAM.  IN REALITY, RESPONDENT FAILED THE LEVEL I CFA EXAM THE FIRST AND ONLY TIME HE TOOK IT.  RESPONDENT'S ACTIONS CONSTITUTE FRAUDULENT BUSINESS PRACTICES.  FURTHERMORE, RESPONDENT CONDUCTED MISLEADING PERFORMANCE REPORTING FOR SGC VIA PERSONALIZED PROPOSALS (PITCHBOOKS) FOR SGC FINANCIAL ADVISORS TO USE IN PRESENTATIONS WITH PROSPECTIVE CLIENTS.  ORIGINALLY, THE PERFORMANCE CHARTS IN THE PITCHBOOKS WERE LABELED AS HYPOTHETICAL OR MODEL PERFORMANCE BECAUSE THE CHARTS WERE NOT BASED ON ACTUAL RETURNS OF THE PROGRAM.  RATHER, THE RETURNS WERE CALCULATED BY BACKTESTING EXISTING ALLOCATIONS AGAINST HISTORICAL DATA.  IN OR ABOUT OCTOBER 2006, CONCERNS WERE RAISED BECAUSE THE HYPOTHETICAL RETURNS CONTAINED IN THE PITCHBOOKS DID NOT MATCH THE ACTUAL RETURNS IN CLIENT PORTFOLIOS.  AUDITING COMMENCED AND PERFORMANCE CHARTS BEGAN CALCULATING RETURNS BASED ON A COMPOSITE OF ACTUAL CLIENT RETURNS.  THE PITCHBOOKS THEN BEGAN TO CONTAIN AUIDITED, COMPOSITE RETURNS FOR YEARS STARTING IN 2005 BUT CONTINUED TO INCLUDE THE UNAUDITED PERFORMANCE DATA FOR 2000 THROUGH 2004.  THIS SET OF DATA WAS LABELED \"HISTORICAL\" EVEN THOUGH THE 2000 THROUGH 2004 FIGURES WERE NOT ACTUAL RETURNS.  RESPONDENT KNEW OF THE MISLEADING LABELING.",
